meanings.definition: Lengthened or extended in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The elongated snake slithered through the grass.
meanings.sent2: The road stretched out in an elongated line towards the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The elongated shadows of the trees looked like spooky monsters in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Her elongated fingers reached out to grab the book from the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The elongated neck of the giraffe towered above the other animals at the zoo.

meanings.definition: To make or become longer in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: She elongated the dress by adding extra fabric to the hem.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar elongated its body as it prepared to transform into a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand elongated to twice its original length during the trick.
meanings.sent4: The artist elongated the portrait to capture the subject's elegant features.
meanings.sent5: The runner elongated her strides to reach the finish line faster.
